title: Global restructuring firm Ankura enters Australian market
text:
Global business consulting and risk management firm Ankura is seeking a slice of the Australian turnaround and restructuring market as part of a broader push into the Asia-Pacific region.

It is understood Ankura is set to announce it has hired former FTI Consulting operative Quentin Olde to spearhead a new Sydney office, and is working on recruiting a broader team.

Ankura is targeting Australia at a time when it would likely argue consolidation locally and a move towards more informal restructuring processes means there is more room for a global boutique which is independent of audit conflicts.

Olde will start at Ankura as a senior managing director, which is the same rank he held in FTI's corporate finance and restructuring team.

He resigned from FTI in March.

Olde is well known in Australia's restructuring market for work on the likes of Clive Palmer's Queensland Nickel and Surfstich's administration in recent years.
description: Ankura is seeking a slice of the Australian turnaround and restructuring market as part of a regional push.
